document.masterDocTitle: Species diversity of ostracods (Crustacea: Ostracoda) from rice fields in Northeast Thailand, with the description of a new Tanycypris species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Species diversity of ostracods (Crustacea: Ostracoda) from rice fields in Northeast Thailand, with the description of a new Tanycypris species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
FEmaLE, SOfT PaRTS dISSEcTEd IN gLYcERINE ON a SEaLEd gLaSS SLIdE, aNd VaLVES STOREd dRY IN a mIcROPaLaEONTOLOgIcaL SLIdE (MSU-ZOC.230).

Paratypes .
ONE dISSEcTEd fEmaLE (MSU-ZOC.231) STOREd LIkE THE
HOLOTYPE
, TWO UNdISSEcTEd fEmaLE caRaPacES (MSU-ZOC.232-233) STOREd dRY IN mIcROPaLaEONTOLOgIcaL SLIdES aNd TWO fEmaLES IN 70% ETOH (MSU-ZOC.234).

Repository. THE HOLOTYPE aNd aLL PaRaTYPES aRE dEPOSITEd IN THE NaTURaL HISTORY MUSEUm, MSU ( MaHa SaRakHam , THaILaNd )
.

RIcE fIELd, MUaNg DISTRIcT, ROI-ET PROVINcE (LOcaLITY NUmbER 22). MaTERIaL cOLLEcTEd ON 23 OcTObER 2010 aNd 25 OcTObER 2014 , cOORdINaTES: 16° 2.067΄ N aNd 103° 52.625΄ E. AccOmPaNYINg OSTRacOd faUNa:

Etymology. THE SPEcIES IS NamEd IN HONOUR Of PROf. DR. EUgEN K. KEmPf (COLOgNE, GERmaNY ) fOR HIS PROmINENT EffORTS ON OSTRacOd cONTRIbUTIONS, ESPEcIaLLY THE KEmPf DaTabaSE OSTRacOda (KDO), THE mOST USEd INdEX Of OSTRacOd TaXONOmY. THIS INVaLUabLE daTabaSE HaS bEEN UPdaTEd aNd IS STILL IN USE . PROf. DR. EUgEN K. KEmPf WaS a fRIENdLY aNd gENEROUS ScIENTIST, aNd THIS SPEcIES IS dEdIcaTEd TO HIm.

Diagnosis. CaRaPacE IN LaTERaL VIEW ELLIPTIcaL, WITH EVENLY aRcHEd dORSaL maRgIN, gREaTEST HEIgHT SITUaTEd aT mId-LENgTH, VENTRaL maRgIN SLIgHTLY SINUOUS; LV OVERLaPPINg RV aNTERIORLY, VENTRaLLY aNd POSTERIORLY; caRaPacE IN dORSaL VIEW ELLIPTIcaL (WIdTH mORE THaN 1/3 Of LENgTH), WITH gREaTEST WIdTH SITUaTEd aT mId-LENgTH, aNTERIOR aNd POSTERIOR EXTREmITIES POINTEd. LV WITH gROOVE aLONg VaLVE maRgIN; caLcIfIEd INNER LamELLa bROad, WITHOUT INNER LIST. RV WITH bROad caLcIfIEd INNER LamELLa, WITHOUT INNER LIST. FIRST SEgmENT Of A1 WITH SUbaPIcaL dORSaL SETa.
TWO LaRgE bRISTLES ON THIRd ENdITE Of MX 1 SmOOTH. T1 WITH TWO a-SETaE
, ONE b-SETa, ONE d-SETa. LENgTH Of GP Of caUdaL RamUS c. 2/3 Of THaT Of Ga, CR aTTacHmENT STOUT, WITH TRIEbEL’S LOOP SITUaTEd aT mIddLE Of dISTaL PaRT Of maIN bRaNcH, db WELL dEVELOPEd, Vb SHORT, STOUT.

Differential diagnosis.
Tanycypris eugenkempfi
n. sp.
dIffERS fROm OTHER
Tanycypris
SPEcIES IN SEVERaL aSPEcTS. THE dISTINcTIVE dIagNOSTIc fEaTURES aRE THE mORE TUmId caRaPacE IN dORSaL VIEW, aPPEaRINg RIcE SEEd SHaPEd, aNd THE dISTINcTLY aRcHEd dORSaL maRgIN Of THE caRaPacE IN LaTERaL VIEW.
Ecology. THE NEW SPEcIES IS ONLY kNOWN fROm TWO RIcE fIELdS. THE SPEcIES OccURS aT a PH RaNgE Of 7.19–7.85, a TEmPERaTURE RaNgE Of 24.5–29.7° C aNd a DO RaNgE Of 5.34–5.85 mg /L.

Description of female. CaRaPacE IN LaTERaL VIEW ( FIg 2A ) ELLIPTIcaL, aNTERIORLY aNd POSTERIORLY maRgINS SUbEqUaLLY ROUNdEd, LV OVERLaPPINg RV, aNTERIORLY, VENTRaLLY aNd POSTERIORLY , dORSaL maRgIN EVENLY aRcHEd, gREaTEST HEIgHT SITUaTEd aT mId-LENgTH, VENTRaL maRgIN SLIgHTLY SINUaTEd, VaLVE SURfacE SOmEWHaT SmOOTH, WITH ScaTTERINg Of THIN SETaE ( FIg 2C ).
CaRaPacE IN dORSaL VIEW ( FIg 2B ) SUbELLIPTIcaL, WITH gREaTEST WIdTH SITUaTEd aT mId-LENgTH, LV OVERLaPPINg RV aNTERIORLY aNd POSTERIORLY , aNTERIOR aNd POSTERIOR ENdS POINTEd.

LV IN INTERIOR VIEW ( FIg 2E ) WITH gROOVE aLONg VaLVE maRgIN, dORSaL maRgIN dISTINcTLY aRcHEd, gREaTEST HEIgHT SITUaTEd aT mId-LENgTH, SLOPINg dOWN TO aNTERIOR aNd POSTERIOR maRgINS, aNTERIOR aNd POSTERIOR maRgINS SUbEqUaLLY, WIdELY ROUNdEd, VENTRaL maRgIN SLIgHTLY SINUaTEd; caLcIfIEd INNER LamELLa RELaTIVELY WIdE aNTERIORLY aNd POSTERIORLY , WITHOUT INNER LIST .
RV IN INTERIOR VIEW ( FIg 2F ) WITH maRgINaL SELVagE, caLcIfIEd INNER LamELLa RELaTIVELY WIdE aNTERIORLY aNd POSTERIORLY , WITHOUT INNER LIST .

subSubSection.paragraph: A1 ( FIg 3A ): fIRST SEgmENT WITH LaRgE, ELONgaTEd PROXImaL WOUTERS ORgaN, ONE SUbaPIcaL dORSaL SETa Of INTERmEdIaTE LENgTH (REacHINg TIP Of SEgmENT) aNd TWO LONg aPIcaL VENTRaL SETaE. SEcONd SEgmENT SLIgHTLY WIdER THaN LONg, WITH ONE SHORT aPIcaL dORSaL SETa (REacHINg TIP Of NEXT SEgmENT) aNd LONg ROmE ORgaN. THIRd SEgmENT bEaRINg TWO SUbEqUaLLY LONg SETaE ( ONE aPIcaL dORSaL SETa, ONE aPIcaL VENTRaL SETa), REacHINg SLIgHTLY bEYONd TIP Of fOURTH SEgmENT. FOURTH SEgmENT WITH TWO LONg dORSaL SETaE aNd TWO SUbEqUaL, SHORTER VENTRaL SETaE ( THE LONg ONE REacHINg TIP Of PENULTImaTE SEgmENT). FIfTH SEgmENT dORSaLLY WITH TWO LONg SETaE, VENTRaLLY WITH TWO ( ONE LONg, ONE SHORTER) SETaE, SHORTER ONE REacHINg TIP Of TERmINaL SEgmENT. TERmINaL SEgmENT WITH THREE ( TWO LONg, ONE SHORT ) aPIcaL SETaE aNd aESTHETaSc Ya, THE LaTTER c. 1.8 TImES THE LENgTH Of SHORT aPIcaL SETa.

A2 ( FIg 3B ): EXOPOd WITH THREE ( ONE LONg, TWO SHORT ) SETaE, LONg ONE REacHINg bEYONd HaLf Of fIRST ENdOPOdaL SEgmENT. FIRST ENdOPOdaL SEgmENT WITH fIVE LONg (REacHINg bEYONd TIP Of TERmINaL cLaWS) aNd ONE SHORT NaTaTORY SETaE, LENgTH Of SHORTEST SETa NOT REacHINg HaLf Of PENULTImaTE SEgmENT (LENgTH c. 1/3 Of THaT Of PENULTImaTE SEgmENT), aESTHETaSc Y LONg, aPIcaL VENTRaL SETa LONg, REacHINg TIP Of PENULTImaTE SEgmENT. PENULTImaTE SEgmENT UNdIVIdEd, dISTaLLY WITH THREE SERRaTEd cLaWS, aESTHETaSc Y2 LONg (aLmOST REacHINg TIP Of TERmINaL SEgmENT), z1–z3 SETaE LONg; THIS SEgmENT mEdIaLLY WITH TWO ( ONE LONg, ONE SHORTER) dORSaL SETaE (LENgTH Of SHORT ONE c. 2/3 Of THaT Of LONg ONE ) aNd fOUR VENTRaL SETaE Of UNEqUaL LENgTH (T1–T4). TERmINaL SEgmENT WITH TWO SERRaTEd cLaWS (GM aNd Gm), g-SETa aNd aESTHETaSc Y3, LENgTH Of Gm c. 3/4 Of THaT Of GM, g-SETa LONg, LENgTH c. 1.3 TImES THaT Of aESTHETaSc Y3, LENgTH Of aESTHETaSc Y3 c. 2/3 Of THaT Of accOmPaNYINg SETa.

subSubSection.paragraph: Md-PaLP ( FIg 4A–B ): fIRST SEgmENT WITH TWO LaRgE SETaE (S1 aNd S2), ONE SLENdER, LONg SETa aNd LONg α-SETa, THE LaTTER SmOOTH WITH LONg POINTEd TIP. , THREE ENdITES aNd a LaRgE bRaNcHIaL PLaTE; baSaL SEgmENT Of PaLP WITH gROUP Of fIVE LONg, UNEqUaL aPIcaL SETaE aNd TWO (ONE LONg, ONE SHORTER) SUbaPIcaL SETaE, SHORTER ONE REacHINg mId LENgTH Of TERmINaL SEgmENT, TERmINaL SEgmENT ELONgaTEd, aPIcaLLY WITH THREE cLaWS aNd THREE SETaE. T3 ( FIg 5B ) cLEaNINg LImb. FIRST SEgmENT WITH LONg d1, d2, dP SETaE. SEcONd SEgmENT WITH LONg aPIcaL E-SETa (SLIgHTLY bEYONd HaLf-WaY Of NEXT SEgmENT). CaUdaL RamUS ( FIg 5C ) WELL-dEVELOPEd, WITH VENTRaL maRgIN STRONgLY SERRaTEd, bEaRINg c. SEVEN gROUPS Of SETULaE, Ga aNd GP cLaWS LONg, SERRaTEd, LENgTH Of Ga c. 1/3 THaT Of RamUS, LENgTH Of GP c. 2/3 THaT Of Ga.
